titleStmt.title: This is the ordinaunce for the conseruation and keping of the Quenes Maiesties swannes and signettes, and of the Lordes spirituall and temporall, and of her Commons within the counties of Lincolne, Northampton, Rutland, Huntington, and Cambridge and the liberties and fraunchyse of the same: and for the conseruacion of fyshe and fowle, with the assissing of all maner of nettes within the sayde Counties and liberties of the same.
Laws, etc.

titleStmt.title: This is the ordinaunce for the conseruation and keping of the Quenes Maiesties swannes and signettes, and of the Lordes spirituall and temporall, and of her Commons within the counties of Lincolne, Northampton, Rutland, Huntington, and Cambridge and the liberties and fraunchyse of the same: and for the conseruacion of fyshe and fowle, with the assissing of all maner of nettes within the sayde Counties and liberties of the same.

notesStmt.note: An ordinance regulating the conservation of swans and cygnets.
Actual printers' names and suggested publication date from STC.
Last complete line of text ends: "her".
Identified as STC 7979 on UMI microfilm reel 455.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: FIRST it is ordeined and Å¿tatuted, that euery perÅ¿on hauing any Swannes, Å¿hal begin yerely to marke or cauÅ¿e to be marked the Å¿ame vpon the Munday next after Trinitie Sunday, & no perÅ¿on afore, but after as the company may, Å¿o that the MaÅ¿ter of the Quenes game of Swannes, or his deputies be there preÅ¿ent, and yf any perÅ¿on or perÅ¿ons take vpon hym or them in marking to the contrary, to forfeyte to the Quene. xl. s.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no perÅ¿on nor perÅ¿ons beyng Swanheards nor other, Å¿hall go on marking without the maÅ¿ter of the Quenes game of Swannes or his deputie bee preÅ¿ent, with vi. or iiii. of the company of Swanheardes, vpon paine to forfeyte to the Quenes grace. xl. s.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no perÅ¿on take vp no Å¿ignet nor Å¿ignets vnmarked, nor make no Å¿ale of them. ãâ¦ã the Quenes Swanherde or his deputie with. iiii. other Swanherdes next adioyning be preÅ¿ent or h â¢â¢â¢ knowledge of the Å¿ame, vpon payne to forfeyt to the Quenes grace. xl. s.

Â· Item it is ordeined that the Swanherde of the duchy of LancaÅ¿ter within the Å¿aid counties, nor within the lib â¢ rt â¢ es and fraunches of the Å¿ame, nor no other perÅ¿on for him nor by him, Å¿hal make no Å¿ale nor ãâ¦ã Swannes, nor marke them within the Å¿aid duchy, without the Quenes Swanherde or his deputie ãâã preÅ¿ent vpon payne to forfeyt to the Quenes grace. xl. s. And in like wiÅ¿e it is ordeyned that ãâã Quenes Swanherde of the foreÅ¿aid counties nor his deputie, Å¿hall not enter into the Å¿aid duchy to ãâ¦ã any Swannes or Å¿ignets, nor them to marke without the Swanherde of the duchy be preÅ¿ent, then paine to forfeyte to the Quenes grace. xl. s.

Â· Item it is ordeined, that if any Swannes or Å¿ignets be found without the Å¿aid duchy double marked or put out of right marke, that then it Å¿hall be Å¿eaÅ¿ed for the Quene, and to be delyuered to the maiÅ¿ter of the Quenes game of Swannes or to his deputie, and Å¿o to remayne to it be proued by. iiii. or vi. Å¿ufficient Swanherdes, to whom the Å¿ayd Swannes or Å¿ignets belong or appertaine, Å¿o that the knowledge of the Å¿ame be had by the Å¿aide Swanherds after the Å¿aid deliuery afore the Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ions of Swannes than ãâã to be kept within the countie, where as it Å¿hall hap the Å¿aid Swans or Å¿ignets to be Å¿eaÅ¿ed and deliuered in fourme aforeÅ¿aid. And yf Å¿o be the property of the Å¿ame Swannes or Å¿ignets can not be knowen by the Å¿aid Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ions, that then the Quene to be aÅ¿Å¿ured of the value of the Å¿ame Swannes and Å¿ignettes.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned that yf any perÅ¿on or perÅ¿ons wylfully put anye Swannes from theyr neÅ¿tes. whereÅ¿oeuer they breede, or els take vp & deÅ¿troy or beare away the egges or egge of the Å¿aide Swannes, to forÅ¿ait for euery default & preÅ¿ented in the Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ions of Swannes to the Quenes grace. xiii.s. iiii.d.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned that no man Å¿hall make Å¿ale of no whyte Å¿wannes, nor make delyuery of them without the maÅ¿ter of the game or his deputie be preÅ¿ent, with iii. o vi. Å¿wanheardes next adioyning vnder payne of xl. s. wherof Å¿halbe to the fynder, vi.s. viii.d. and the reÅ¿idue to the Quene.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned that no perÅ¿on or perÅ¿ons hunt in fene tyme or in any haunt of Swannes with dogges, from the feaÅ¿t of EaÅ¿ter to the Å¿unday after Triuitie Å¿unday, vpon payne for euery tyme Å¿o doyng. vi.s. viii. d.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned that yf any perÅ¿on Å¿et any Å¿nares or anye manner of inginnes to take Bittors or Swannes betwixt the feaÅ¿t of EaÅ¿ter and Lammas, he or they to forfeit for euery tyme Å¿o Å¿etting any Å¿uch ingins vi. s. viii. d.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no perÅ¿on nor perÅ¿ons Å¿hall lay no net nor nettes, or dragge with net nor nets within the common Å¿tremes, waters nor maryÅ¿hes vpon the day tyme, from the feaÅ¿t of the Inuen
â¢ ion of the holy croÅ¿Å¿e, vnto the feaÅ¿t of Lammas, vpon payne as often as they be found in fault and preÅ¿ented in the Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ions of Å¿wannes before the Quenes IuÅ¿tices. xx.s. to forfeit to the Queenes grace.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that euery Å¿wanherde intending to keepe any Å¿wannes or Å¿ignettes, that they â¢â¢â¢ l keepe them in a pen or pit within. xx. foote of the coÌmon Å¿treme, or els within xx. foote of the Quenes â¢â¢ gh way, Å¿o that the Quenes Å¿ubiectes paÅ¿Å¿yng by may haue the Å¿yght of the Å¿ayde Å¿wannes, vpon payne ãâã xl. s.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that there Å¿halbe nor forfeyt of whyte Å¿wannes nor grey Å¿wannes no Å¿ignets but ãâã to the Quenes grace. aÅ¿well within the fraunches and liberties as without: and as often as any ãâã Å¿eaÅ¿e and delyuer the Å¿ayde Å¿wannes to any other perÅ¿on, but only to the maÅ¿ter of the game or to the Quenes vÅ¿e, he to forfait to the Quenes grace. vi.s.viii.d.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no maner of perÅ¿on nor perÅ¿ons Å¿hal lay nor Å¿et nettes named tramels, nor n â¢ ttes called drayes, nor dray with no net from the xvi. day next before the feaÅ¿t of Å¿aint Marke the Euan
â¢â¢ liÅ¿t. vnto the xvi day next enÅ¿uing the Å¿ame feaÅ¿t. That is to wit, within the coÌmon Å¿tremes, waters, Å¿ â¢â¢â¢â¦ es and marÅ¿hes in the countie of Lincolne, Northampton, Rutland, Huntyngton, and Cambridge, no â¢ within the Ile of Ely, vpon payne of. xl.s.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no man Å¿hal take no gray Å¿wannes nor white Å¿wannes flying, but that he Å¿hall within iiii. dayes next after the Å¿ayd taking, deliuer it or them to the maÅ¿ter of the Quenes Å¿wannes ãâã to his deputie to the Quenes vÅ¿e, and the taker to huaue for his takyng. viii.d.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no maner of perÅ¿on of what eÅ¿tate, degree, or condicion be be, hauing any game of Å¿wannes of his owne, Å¿halbe no Å¿wanheard nor keper of none other mens Å¿wannes, vpon payne ãâã xl. s.

Â¶ Item it is ordeyned, that no Å¿wanherde nor fiÅ¿her, nor fowler, Å¿hall not vexe nor trouble another â¢â¢â¢â¢ nherde, fyÅ¿her nor fowler, by way of action, or otherwyÅ¿e, but onely afore the Quenes IuÅ¿tices of her Å¿eÅ¿Å¿ions of Å¿wannes, vpon payne of forfaiting to the Quenes grace. xiii.s. iiii.d.
